purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of various breakdowns of systems. A system breakdown is a partitioning of a system into a set of related elements to support engineering, analysis and other activities that may be performed in relation to the system. These breakdowns are explicit, parent-child views that comprise the system elements.

The system breakdown view is complementary to the assembly structure and bill of materials views that are the primary focus for manufacturing (realization) of a system (see Part definition relationship). System breakdowns may be of designs or realized individual systems. For any system, more than one breakdown may exist to support various different engineering activities.
purpose.example: A heating system might comprise a heat generation system and a heat distribution system.

inscope.li: the identification of breakdowns of a system;
the identification of the system elements that comprise a breakdown;
the identification of parent-child relationships between system breakdown elements;
the relationships between elements in different system breakdowns;

the representation of how a system breakdown element is realized by a product.
The system breakdown element 'heating system' might be realized by a 'heating element' product.

outscope.li: all system views whose components have no parent-child relationships.

uof.name: System_Breakdown
uof.description: The System_Breakdown UoF specifies the definitional information for the concepts of system breakdown identification and relationships between elements in a system breakdown.

uof.name: System_Element
uof.description: The System_Element UoF specifies the definitional information for the concepts of system breakdown views according to the system hierarchy of a product.
